gameRules.title: Game Rules
chessRules: Each player starts with 16 pieces: 1 king, 1 queen, 2 rooks, 2 bishops, 2 knights, and 8 pawns.
White moves first, then players alternate turns.
The objective is to checkmate the opponent's king.
Special moves include castling, en passant, and pawn promotion.
A game can end in checkmate, stalemate, resignation, or draw by agreement.
checkersRules: Each player starts with 12 pieces on dark squares.
Pieces move diagonally forward one square.
Multi-jump captures are allowed in a single turn.
Pieces reaching the opposite end become kings and can move backward.
Win by capturing all opponent pieces or blocking all their moves.
backgammonRules: The board has 24 points numbered 1-24. Each player has 15 checkers.
Gold (Player) moves CLOCKWISE from point 24 → 1. Black (AI) moves COUNTER-CLOCKWISE from point 1 → 24.
Gold's home board is points 1-6. Black's home board is points 19-24.
Roll two dice to determine movement. Use each die value for separate moves.
Doubles grant four moves of that value instead of two.
Land on opponent's single checker (blot) to hit it to the bar.
Checkers on the bar MUST re-enter before any other moves.
Bear off begins when ALL 15 checkers reach your home board.
First to bear off all checkers wins. Gammon (2×) if loser has 0 off. Backgammon (3×) if loser also has checker on bar or winner's home.
ludoRules: Each player has 4 tokens starting in their home base.
Roll a 6 to move a token from base to start.
Move tokens clockwise around the board based on dice roll.
Land on opponent's token to send it back to base.
Rolling a 6 grants an extra turn.
First player to move all 4 tokens to the finish wins.
dominosRules: Each player draws 7 tiles from a shuffled set.
Player with the highest double (e.g., [6|6]) goes first.
If no player has a double, highest pip count tile determines first player.
Match tile ends to play (e.g., 6 connects to 6).
Draw from the boneyard if you can't play.
First to play all tiles or lowest pip count when blocked wins.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.section1Text: 1M Gaming is a decentralized application. We do not collect personal information beyond what is publicly available on the blockchain. When you connect your wallet, we only access your public wallet address.
privacy.section2Text: Your wallet address is used solely to facilitate gameplay, manage game rooms, and process prize distributions on the Solana network.
privacy.section3Text: Game states and transaction records are stored on the Solana blockchain and are publicly accessible. We do not maintain private databases of user information.
privacy.section4Text: We use browser local storage to save your preferences (language, sound settings). No tracking cookies are used.
privacy.section5Text: We integrate with Solana wallet providers (Phantom, Solflare, Backpack) and blockchain infrastructure. These services have their own privacy policies.
privacy.section6Text: 1M Gaming is not intended for users under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect information from minors.
privacy.section7Text: For privacy-related questions, contact us at
privacy.disclaimerText: Skill-based games only. No gambling. No chance-based payouts.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.skillBasedText: 1M Gaming is a competitive skill-based gaming platform. All games are determined purely by player skill and strategy – never by luck or chance.
terms.skillPoint1: No gambling – outcomes are determined by skill only
terms.skillPoint2: No chance-based payouts – winners earn through superior play
terms.skillPoint3: No random number generators affect game outcomes
terms.cryptoText: 1M Gaming does not buy, sell, or trade cryptocurrency. We are a gaming platform, not a crypto exchange.
terms.cryptoPoint1: We do not exchange fiat currency for cryptocurrency
terms.cryptoPoint2: All transactions use SOL on the Solana network
terms.cryptoPoint3: Players must acquire SOL independently through licensed exchanges
terms.gasFeesText: Solana network fees are minimal (typically less than $0.01 per transaction). You pay the entry fee plus a small network fee for each game action.
terms.fairPlayText: All games use verifiable on-chain logic with commit-reveal randomness for games like Ludo, Backgammon, and Dominos. Game states are stored on the blockchain for transparency and dispute resolution.
terms.noticeText: By using 1M Gaming, you confirm you are 18+ and agree to compete in skill-based games only. We reserve the right to suspend accounts engaging in collusion or unfair play.
